roleset.name: to accommodate, settle, accept

example.name: transitive
example.text: Under federal transportation law , [a government mediator]-1 is attempting [*-1] to reconcile the melding of Tiger 's job classifications into Federal 's .
example.arg: the melding of Tiger 's job classifications into Federal 's

example.name: all arguments
example.text: As a result , Mr. Steinhardt must reconcile himself to [*-1] selling USAir at a loss , or to [*-1] holding the shares as an old - fashioned investment .
example.arg: to [*-1] selling USAir at a loss

example.name: arg2
example.text: President Clinton says he hopes his talks with the top North Korean envoy here in Washington next week will help promote reconciliation with Pyong Yang

example.name: all args
example.text: Although he had already worked out his reconciliation of the Christian mysteries with the mechanical philosophy in Mainz around 1670 ...
example.arg: with the mechanical philosophy in Mainz

example.name: things reconciled together in a single arg
example.text: ... but also as a framework for his reconciliation of ethics , phenomenology and postmodernity .

example.name: just arg1 (not arg0)
example.text: Iraqi Foreign Minister Hoshyar al - Zebari called during his meeting with Egyptian President Hosni Mubarak for supporting the efforts of Iraqi reconciliation .

roleset.note: RECONCILE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'reconcile' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus. (from reconcile.01-v predicate notes)
RECONCILIATION-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on reconcile-v.01. No corresponding VNcls. (from reconciliation.01-n)
